instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_3GH: What is PPBUS_3GH? PPBUS_3GH is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. If you see someone type PPBUS_3GH assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Not working with battery
threads.message:
The board came in dead
Detected a partial shot on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_3GH</SIGNAL>
Found that <CHIP>U8050</CHIP> is getting hot, I replaced it.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>-present
It’s drawing 20v and it’s booting well without battery
After connecting j6950 flex battery flex , the system will start to draw 5v and the TypeC c ammeter will be restarting every 2 sec. Until the flex is detached. It will normalize.
and I have tried another battery , same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Not working with battery
threads.message:
Tried known good battery for sure?
Be aware, "new" is not equal with "known good".

I recommend you to get the battery port tester in the repair shop.
[URL unfurl="true"]http://www.cmizapper.com/products/battery-port-tester.html[/URL]
It shows you if there is a communication problem on the battery bus.

Also NLBA helps you to fully diagnose the battery.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.laptopu.ro/[/URL]
You can also reset and repair the batteries with it.
